title: mich
author: mich
content: Well yesterday Apple did a announcement for the new Iphone 15 and IPhone 15 max. The prices are $999 and $1199 which is most expensive Iphone ever.Is anyone going to buy this? I do not think I will be spending this much money on a phone if there is nothing wrong with the one I have. But I will say it does sound amazing. https://www.nytimes.com/2023/09/12/technology/apple-iphone-15-usb-c.html

comments.author: Ucy
comments.body: We should be spending that amount on Opensource phones/OS that allow us to connect with like-minded people with similar preferences.Certain OS/phones like the one you mention are not pro freedom in developments. And the little freedom and fundamental rights are reduced with new releases until their users nolonger have any.Lesser freedom means more enslavement to the head or the one at the center whom everything is connected to. When users are more controlled by the head they become as evil as he is and they will be cursed with all manner of disasters. So, basically the newer ones attract curses or problems to their owners because they will be more connected to the very bad entity in the middle who is so cursed. I know it would be abit hard to see friends, family and countrymen buying the latest technology while you are left with the old but it's for our own good. The world is drifting fast to the pit and evil makes the drifting faster. I hope decentralized people learn to live without centralized world and begin to rely more on the good alternatives.  That's what we will be communicating with when freedom is completely gone with choas and tyranny reigning on earth.

comments.author: TobeyHolo
comments.body: I am personally a sucker for these phones. They have a nice interface and have always been reliable on battery life by the period of the first 2-3 years. Noting the price, I don't see much change between the 14 and 15? The prices are always somewhat similar less $100+/- OP?

comments.author: peter0425
comments.body: no and never , I am a practical person , i rather use cheap phone than spending that much.

comments.author: Pingrapole
comments.body: The new version of the phone will be more expensive, it is normal in terms of features, but such an expensive phone is not for everyone, because a product depends on the status of people.I cannot buy such an expensive phone because I do not have that much money. Yes, the phone is very good But I think somebody will definitely buy and a lot of people will buy because in today's age many People not doing not buy any product just for work but for hobby or luxury only those who want luxury will buy.This is actually quite a surprise in today's context but not surprising to many.Personally I think it makes no sense to spend so much money and I would never buy it as it would create a disparity.

comments.author: maxxmad
comments.body: There are no revolutionary changes. I'll stick with my iPhone 12 mini for now.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Quote from: maxxmad on September 14, 2023, 01:18:56 PMThere are no revolutionary changes. I'll stick with my iPhone 12 mini for now.Rear camera 12-megapixel camera now 48-megapixelA15 Bionic chip now A16 Bionic chip6.1-inch Super Retina XDR now 6.1-inch Super Retina XDRLightning port for charging now USB-C port

comments.author: DYING_S0UL
comments.body: Quote from: mich on September 15, 2023, 05:12:06 AMQuote from: maxxmad on September 14, 2023, 01:18:56 PMThere are no revolutionary changes. I'll stick with my iPhone 12 mini for now.Rear camera 12-megapixel camera now 48-megapixelA15 Bionic chip now A16 Bionic chip6.1-inch Super Retina XDR now 6.1-inch Super Retina XDRLightning port for charging now USB-C port We don't even need that much of CPU or Camera power.   Who needs that anyway? If it fulfills the daily need then it's enough. Every year Apple would release a new iPhone with nothing NEW. Maybe a smaller display or maybe less weight or maybe some more megapixels. There isn't anything creativity. At least they adopted to USB-C.   (after 10 years though).

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: mich on September 13, 2023, 06:26:47 AMWell yesterday Apple did a announcement for the new Iphone 15 and IPhone 15 max. The prices are $999 and $1199 which is most expensive Iphone ever.Is anyone going to buy this? I do not think I will be spending this much money on a phone if there is nothing wrong with the one I have. But I will say it does sound amazing. https://www.nytimes.com/2023/09/12/technology/apple-iphone-15-usb-c.htmllol 12 hundred dollars? that would be my month and a half salary lol..never that I will spend that much for a phone .

comments.author: bayu7adi
comments.body: Even if you refrain from making a purchase, sales remain robust. Apple has its own niche for its premium gadgets. Such a sum holds little significance in the eyes of a millionaire. So long as the iPhone continues to offer enhanced value for their business endeavors and they possess substantial reserves, why not?I aspire to acquire an iPhone 15, should it serve my productive interests. However, at present, my current mobile device adequately fulfills my business needs. Hence, it is not yet the opportune moment to replace my old phone.

comments.author: TobeyHolo
comments.body: Quote from: DYING_S0UL on September 16, 2023, 02:03:25 PMEveryones reaction    You've convinced me and gave me a good laugh. Hahaha

comments.author: Zenp
comments.body: This gave me a good laugh aswell  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=obi1I3IsGY8https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6lTu9z4AwNUAdding USB 2 and acting like they did something ground breaking!

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: DYING_S0UL on September 15, 2023, 07:41:31 PMQuote from: mich on September 15, 2023, 05:12:06 AMQuote from: maxxmad on September 14, 2023, 01:18:56 PMThere are no revolutionary changes. I'll stick with my iPhone 12 mini for now.Rear camera 12-megapixel camera now 48-megapixelA15 Bionic chip now A16 Bionic chip6.1-inch Super Retina XDR now 6.1-inch Super Retina XDRLightning port for charging now USB-C port We don't even need that much of CPU or Camera power.   Who needs that anyway? If it fulfills the daily need then it's enough. Every year Apple would release a new iPhone with nothing NEW. Maybe a smaller display or maybe less weight or maybe some more megapixels. There isn't anything creativity. At least they adopted to USB-C.   (after 10 years though). We don't need it but photographers need that camera mega pixels, and the gamers as well as performance enthusiasts need that extra CPU power. A basic user doesn't need those features but someone who's really a power user can utilize those in the best way possible. The Apple iPhones are known for their quick performance and great camera quality, and iPhone lovers can spend a lot of money to avail every new version of the smartphone that Apple releases. I agree the USB-C port is the best new feature in iPhones and overall the iPhone 15 is much improved from its predecessor. Although, I'm not a fan of Apple products but I still think that Apple doesn't sacrifice on quality when it comes to products. The price tag for those products is always much higher than other brands but still I believe that most other brands doesn't focus much on quality of the products.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Quote from: Zenp on September 18, 2023, 03:19:55 PMThis gave me a good laugh aswell  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=obi1I3IsGY8https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6lTu9z4AwNUAdding USB 2 and acting like they did something ground breaking! Well yes here is that thing about the USB-C port. Its that this already is out with the other products that can use it. This port is being used since 2014.So I think you are correct it could have been on older Iphones.  But they are waiting to add it to this one to act like it is such a new thing.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: DYING_S0UL on September 16, 2023, 02:03:25 PMEveryones reaction  nice illustration here mate lol.
